		<div id="myName1"><p>My Name is</p></div>
		<div id="myName2"><p>David Donahue</p></div>
		<div id="bioInfo"><p>And I am a 24 year old native of East Falmouth, Massachusetts.</p></div>

		<div id="bioTopic1"><p>I graduated from Falmouth High School in 2009 and in the following autumn,
		I started at Fitchburg State University to pursue a Major in Film & Video.</p></div>
		<div id="bioTopic2"><p>By my second semester, I began taking a series of Graphic Design courses
		that allowed me to declare a dual-concentration within the Communications Major.</p></div>
		<div id="bioTopic3"><p>I still continued with Film & Video. And I continued furthering my studies,
		branching into other fields like Web Design and Art Design. </p></div>

		<div id="bioTopic4"><p>When the Fall semester of 2012 rolled around, 
		I was offered a spot in the new Game Design
		Workshop course, in which I excelled. The following semester I took part in
		two more Game Design courses, and with the new offering of a Game Design Major
		for students of the University, I eagerly became a Double Major with Three
		Concentrations.</p></div>
		<br/>
		<div id="bioTopic5"><p>After eleven semesters with Fitchburg State, I present to you my Portfolio Website.
		Here you will find a collection of my best works from the last six years.
		I do hope you find them enjoyable. </p></div>

	<div id="portfolio_display_extended">
		<div id="portfolio_gamedesign_extended">
			<input type="image" src="button_portfolio_close.png" class="button_portfolio_extended_close" id="button_portfolio_extended_close_gamedesign" />
			<div id="portfolio_gamedesign_extended_colonistsfe">
				<p><i>Colonists of the Spiral Nebula: First Edition</i> is the pilot entry to a Franchise that
				at its core is about Space Ships and Asteroids. Aimed at mobile devices, <i>Colonists</i> is an
				illustrated attempt to recreate the look and feel of classic arcade shooters. <br/>
				<br/>
				The game received early popularity during its birth month of October 2012, and through the many
				months of development since, has gone on into merchandising, publicity, a mini-game, and a 
				sequel currently in beta development. <br/>
				<br/>
				I have personally acted as the game's lead designer, artist, and mathematician.
				From my work with <i>Colonists</i>, I have been able to see the world and attack problem-solving
				in entirely new ways. <br/>
				<br/>
				<br/>
				<i>Colonists of the Spiral Nebula</i> has made public appearances at the following:<br/>
				<br/>
				Visions 2013                     Fitchburg, MA <br/>
				GameCon 2013                     Fitchburg, MA <br/>
				Penny Arcade Expo East 2013      Boston, MA <br/>
				GameCon 2014                     Fitchburg, MA <br/>
				Penny Arcade Expo East 2014      Boston, MA <br/>
				<br/>
				<br/>
				<br/>
				External Links for <i>Colonists of the Spiral Nebula</i>: <br/>
				to <a href="https://www.facebook.com/ColonistsoftheSpiralNebula">Facebook</a><br/>
				to <a href="http://www.redbubble.com/people/3daysmade/collections/256334-colonists-of-the-spiral-nebula">Merchandise</a><br/>
				to <a href="http://arcade.gamesalad.com/games/124920"><i>Colonists of the Spiral Nebula: Extended Edition</i></a><br/>
				
				</p>
			</div>
			<div id="portfolio_gamedesign_extended_circles">
				<p><i>Circles</i> is an experiment with Mathematics. It is not a game, however the research that
				has gone into developing the project is substantial enough for its inclusion.<br/>
				<br/>
				It is aptly named, as the orbiting spheres represent the results of a
				two-year query into "How to Make an Object Move in a Circle". <br/>
				<br/>
				The movements are entirely mathematical, and it was my personal quest to figure out how
				to make it all work. And the final work goes beyond circles, also encompassing ellipsoids,
				spirals, and corkscrews. <br/>
				<br/>
				These mathematical feats are important because they help pave the way for development of
				Artificial Intelligence in Game Design, specifically in designing paths for the entities
				to travel on. Further research is currently being worked on to have such A.I. travel along
				the paths of a Figure 8 and even polygonal pathways. <br/>
				<br/>
				The formulas developed for the work are presented below: <br/>
				<br/>
				<img src="portfolio_gamedesign_circles_math.png" alt="portfolio_gamedesign_circles_math" style="width: px; height: px"><br/>				
				</p>
			</div>
		</div>
